page.title: 08SCHOOL CLOSURES, RUGELEY
page.content: Following falling school rolls, the closure of Aelfgar Comprehensive School was announced in 1984 to take effect from September, 1985. The first year pupils in 1985 were divided between the 2 other secondary schools. After closure, Aelfgar will become a sixth form college. The school playing fields were to be sold for housing but it seems that at least part is held in trust for recreational purposes. In contrast, the Chancel Infants School was to close in September 1984 but following strong representations by the parents' action committee up to the Secretary of State for Education, the closure proposal was withdrawn. If closed, there would be no primary school in the older part of the town. School closures are proposed in neighbouring communities and school catchment areas have been changed.
